revised_title: Peyton Rous: Discovering the First Cancer Virus
tldr: Francis Peyton Rous, a renowned leader in pathology and cancer research, discovered a virus causing tumors in fowls in 1909. His groundbreaking work was initially disregarded, but later led to significant advancements in understanding cancer and its origins. Rous's discovery of the first cancer virus, now known as the Rous sarcoma virus, has been widely studied and continues to yield valuable insights into cancer research.
